greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into parts with digital root = 9.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..19683
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Digital Root
formula: a(9n) = A000041(n) and for all others a(n) = 0. [_Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 25 2010]
mathematica: f[n_] := PartitionsP[n/9] If[Mod[n, 9] == 0, 1, 0]; Array[f, 105] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 25 2010 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 12 2006
